verses.text: Then I being grieved did weep, and in \add my\add* sorrow prayed, saying,
O Lord, thou art just, and all thy works and all thy ways \add are\add* mercy and truth, and thou judgest truly and justly for ever.
Remember me, and look on me, punish me not for my sins and ignorances, and \add the sins\add* of my fathers, who have sinned before thee:

for they obeyed not thy commandments: wherefore thou hast delivered us for a spoil, and \add unto\add* captivity, and \add unto\add* death, and \add for\add* a proverb of reproach to all the nations among whom we are dispersed.
And now thy judgments are many and true: deal with me according to my sins and my fathers’: because we have not kept thy commandments, neither have walked in truth before thee.

Now therefore deal with me as seemeth best unto thee, \add and\add* command my spirit to be taken \add from me\add*, that I may be dissolved, and become earth: for it is profitable for me to die rather than to live, because I have heard false reproaches, and have much sorrow: command \add therefore\add* that I may now be delivered out of \add this\add* distress, \add and go\add* into the everlasting place: turn not thy face away from me.
It came to pass the same day, that in Ecbatane \add a city\add* of Media Sara the daughter of Raguel was also reproached by her father’s maids;

because that she had been married to seven husbands, whom Asmodeus the evil spirit had killed, before they had lain with her. Dost thou not know, said they, that thou hast strangled thine husbands? thou hast had already seven husbands, neither wast thou named after any of them.
Wherefore dost thou beat us for them? if they be dead, go thy ways after them, let us never see of thee either son or daughter.

When she heard these \add things\add*, she was very sorrowful, so that \add she thought\add* to have strangled herself; and she said, I am the only \add daughter\add* of my father, \add and\add* if I do this, it shall be a reproach unto him, and I shall bring his old age with sorrow unto the grave.
Then she prayed toward the window, and said, Blessed art thou, O Lord my God, and thine holy and glorious name \add is\add* blessed and honourable for ever: let all thy works praise thee for ever.
And now, O Lord, I set mine eyes and my face toward thee,
\add and\add* say, Take me out of the earth, that I may hear no more \add the\add* reproach.
Thou knowest, Lord, that I am pure from all sin with man,

and \add that\add* I never polluted my name, nor the name of my father, in the land of my captivity: I am the only \add daughter\add* of my father, neither hath he \add any\add* child to be his heir, neither \add any\add* near kinsman, nor \add any\add* son of his alive, to whom I may keep myself \add for\add* a wife: my seven \add husbands\add* are already dead; and why should I live? but if it please not thee that I should die, command some regard to be had of me, and pity taken of me, that I hear no more reproach.
So the prayers of \add them\add* both were heard before the majesty of the great God.

And Raphael was sent to heal \add them\add* both, \add that is\add*, to scale away the whiteness of Tobit’s \add eyes\add*, and to give Sara the daughter of Raguel \add for\add* a wife to Tobias the son of Tobit; and to bind Asmodeus the evil spirit; because she belongeth to Tobias by right of inheritance. The selfsame time came Tobit home, and entered into his house, and Sara the \add daughter\add* of Raguel came down from her upper chamber.
